titleStmt.title: A precept for the baptisme of infants out of the New Testament. Where the matter is first proved from three severall scriptures, that there is such a word of command. Secondly it is vindicated, as from the exceptions of the separation, so in special from the cavils of Mr. Robert Everard in a late treatise of his intituled Baby-Baptisme routed. / By Nathaniel Stephens minister of the Gospel and Fennie-Drayton in Leicester-Shire.
titleStmt.author: Stephens, Nathaniel, 1606?-1678.

titleStmt.title: A precept for the baptisme of infants out of the New Testament. Where the matter is first proved from three severall scriptures, that there is such a word of command. Secondly it is vindicated, as from the exceptions of the separation, so in special from the cavils of Mr. Robert Everard in a late treatise of his intituled Baby-Baptisme routed. / By Nathaniel Stephens minister of the Gospel and Fennie-Drayton in Leicester-Shire.
titleStmt.author: Stephens, Nathaniel, 1606?-1678.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by T.R. and E.M. for Edmund Paxton, Nathanaell Webb and William Grantham; and are to be sold in Pauls Chaine neer Doctors Commons, and at the Greyhound in Pauls Church-yard,

notesStmt.note: The tract by Robert Everard is untraced.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
